Yes, there are several game engines that are beginner-friendly and easy to use. Here are a few examples:

1. **Construct 3:** This is a beginner-friendly game engine that uses a drag-and-drop interface to create games without the need for coding. It includes a library of pre-made assets and tools for creating games in 2D and 3D.
2. **GameMaker Studio:** This is another beginner-friendly game engine that uses a drag-and-drop interface as well as its own scripting language called GML. It includes a library of pre-made assets and tools for creating games in 2D and 3D.
3. **Stencyl:** This is a beginner-friendly game engine that uses a block-based programming interface, making it easy for beginners to learn programming concepts. It includes a library of pre-made assets and tools for creating games in 2D and 3D.

A game engine is software that provides a set of tools and resources for creating video games. It includes features such as graphics rendering, physics simulation, animation, and sound. The game engine provides a framework for developers to build their games on, allowing them to focus on creating game content rather than worrying about low-level programming details. By using a game engine, developers can save time and effort in creating games and create more sophisticated and polished games than they would be able to do on their own.
